page.title: 05Trees On Mulderie _ Mulben
page.content: The main species of conifer tree planted by the Forestry Commission on the Hill of Mulderie are {Pine, {Spruce }and {Larch. The Scots Pine is native to Scotland and the Lodgepole Pine comes from Alaska and the Rocky Mountains. Three different types of Larch tree are to be found in the Mulderie Plantation. The Larch sheds its needles every Autumn. Two types of Spruce tree are grown. The Sitka Spruce, which is named after Sitka Island, Alaska, is the biggest of the Spruce trees. Many Sitka Spruce trees grow to be 80 metres high. It also grows faster than any other tree. It can grow 1 Metre each year. The Norway Spruce is also to be found on Mulderie. We know it as the Christmas Tree.
